snippet: For years, scientists have tried to coax important chemical reactions out of nonprecious metals. Three different teams of researchers have pulled it off.
abstract: Chemical reactions that help produce products from margarine to medications rely on valuable metals like platinum and rhodium as catalysts; three studies published in journal Science report development of catalysts based on cheap metals that can match or outperform those based on precious metals.
lead_paragraph: For years, scientists have tried to coax important chemical reactions out of nonprecious metals. Three different teams of researchers have pulled it off.
